documentType: grand jury subpoena and compliance response
summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to AT&T on August 11, 2019, seeking extensive telephone records for specific numbers from July 6, 2019 onward. It includes AT&T's compliance response with a custodian declaration and certificate of authenticity dated August 15, 2019, confirming the production of responsive records.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: He is the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the grand jury subpoena demanding records from AT&T.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to AT&T
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to AT&T, demanding extensive telephone records for specific numbers from July 6, 2019 onward.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: AT&T was commanded to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Manhattan, though the subpoena allowed compliance via document production.

events.title: AT&T Compliance and Certification
events.description: AT&T's Legal Compliance Analyst submits responsive records and a certification of authenticity in compliance with the subpoena, avoiding the need for a physical appearance.

locations: 11760 US HWY 1, SUITE 300, NORTH PALM BEACH, FL 33408
1 ST ANDREWS PLAZA, NEW YORK, NY 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to AT&T on August 11, 2019, seeking extensive telephone records for specific numbers from July 6, 2019 onward.
The subpoena was signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman, indicating active federal investigation by the Southern District of New York in August 2019.
AT&T complied by August 15, 2019, providing records with a custodian declaration certifying their authenticity under Federal Rules of Evidence.
The subpoena sought detailed subscriber, billing, call detail, text message, and device information, indicating a focus on communication patterns and identities.
The document is part of the evidence collection process for an investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371, 1001, and 1519 (conspiracy, false statements, and destruction of evidence).
